content: Since Anonymity and Privacy are so much important when you have Bitcoin in your wallet. That is the reason for my creating this topic. If you have or know any other wallet that provides you with the same then please leave your reply. Let's get started.The need for secure and private Bitcoin wallets has become a pressing issue for users. With so many different types of Bitcoin wallets available, it can be difficult to know which one is right for you. Let's explore the top 3 Bitcoin wallets for complete anonymity as per my understanding.Let me first discuss the type of Bitcoin wallet available on the market.There are many different types of Bitcoin wallets, each with its own unique features and benefits. These include online wallets, hardware wallets, and mobile wallets. While these wallets offer convenience and ease of use, they may not always provide the level of anonymity that some users require. In this situation, anonymous Bitcoin wallets are useful.What do we need to look for in a wallet for privacy & anonymity?In order to choose an anonymous Bitcoin wallet, there are several important factors to consider. First and foremost, security features are crucial. Look for wallets that offer private key protection, two-factor authentication, and other security features to protect your privacy and keep your funds secure.Another important factor to consider is offline storage. Many of the most secure and anonymous Bitcoin wallets offer cold storage options, which allow you to store your funds offline for added security. This can be especially important if you are storing large amounts of Bitcoin.In the end, consider choosing a decentralized and non-custodial wallet for greater control over your funds. Decentralized wallets allow you to maintain full control over your private keys, while non-custodial wallets do not require you to trust a third party with your funds.My recommendation of Bitcoin wallets that are best for complete anonymityWasabi Wallet:Wasabi Wallet is a desktop Bitcoin wallet that is designed specifically for complete anonymity. It offers private key protection, coinjoin transactions, and Tor integration for added privacy. Wasabi Wallet also offers cold storage options, which allow you to store your funds offline for added security.PROS-High level of anonymity and privacy.Offers coinjoin transactions for added privacy.Allows offline storage.CONS-Beginners might find it more challenging to use it.Samourai Wallet:Samourai Wallet is a mobile Bitcoin wallet that is designed for complete anonymity. It offers private key protection, stealth mode, and coinjoin transactions for added privacy. Samourai Wallet also allows for offline storage and does not require any personal information to be submitted during the sign-up process.PROS-High level of anonymity and privacy.Offers coinjoin transactions for added privacy.IMO it has a user-friendly interface.CONS-This is one of the smallest issues as it is only available as a mobile app but some users would question the security of mobile devices Electrum Wallet:This is my personal favorite Bitcoin wallet which is available both for desktop and mobile devices. I recommend the desktop Bitcoin wallet as it provides more features, strong security than the mobile app. It offers private key protection, two-factor authentication, and multi-signature transactions for added security. Electrum Wallet also allows for cold storage options, which can be especially useful for storing large amounts of Bitcoin.PROS-High level of anonymity and privacy.IMO it has a user-friendly interface.Very simple interface.CONS-May not offer as high a level of anonymity as other walletsRecapWhen it comes to choosing an anonymous Bitcoin wallet, there are many factors to consider. Look for wallets that offer strong security features, offline storage options, and decentralized control over your funds. Wasabi Wallet, Samourai Wallet, and Electrum Wallet are all excellent choices for those looking for complete anonymity in their Bitcoin transactions. The ideal wallet for you will ultimately depend on your unique requirements and tastes. Consider your priorities and choose the wallet that is right for you.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: How can these bitcoin wallets provide complete anonymity and privacy when they are meant to always be online? What you need is a hardware wallet with an air-gapped feature, completely offline is the only solution. Hackers rely on internet connection or USB slot connection to steal your information,  when it comes to air-gapped devices there is no way hackers can take advantage of your wallet,  they are always offline.

comments.author: Jon_Hodl
comments.body: I don't think there's a way to achieve perfect privacy or anonymity but I use Sparrow wallet, run my own node/electrum server, CoinJoin, and practice good privacy like using coin control etc. With that combo I have a pretty high level of privacy but I don't think it will ever be perfect. If your wallet is connecting to random electrum servers to update your address balances, I would consider that completely compromised and little to no privacy. IMHO, there is no privacy without running your own node.
